caption: I visit this eglise very often but I never noticed the structure or the sculptures surrounding me. It really is a beautiful and quite different eglise. I have never actually seen in a church before a beautiful sculpture of a man and a woman embracing in the hand of God - It really is beautiful. On the right hand side.as you walk in there is a room with Our Lady and her son, Jesus, and she is comforting him in his final moments - beautiful but also emotional. The structure on the inside reminds me of an old railway station - it's very different. There is also a little garden out the back which is super pretty. I would recommend to visit here no matter what your belief or religion as its really lovely to see.

Fascinating church - well worth visiting if you're interested in architecture.  Also, the walk through the local neighborhood (Pernety) was interesting with a range of building styles, people, etc.  I happened to arrive during a service which was well attended by babies to very senior citizens and all ethnicities.  The quick backstory is that this was built in an area where there was a tremendous amount of construction and development being done in the 1890s; many artisans from other countries like Italy and Portugal came to the area so a church was needed to serve them.  The key to its fame is that the interior is all steel or iron metal work ‚Äì girders, curved pieces, etc. And it‚Äôs all painted a pale green, and the girder columns and chapels are painted in art nouveau style with flowers, shades of green for the foliage and various pinks, red, lavender.  Apparently when workers were deconstructing halls from various universal exhibitions, the steel hoops from the roof of the 1900 Universal exhibition were repurposed for the church‚Äôs vaulted nave. Dark wooden ceiling contrast nicely with the pale green metalwork. The murals and chapel paintings include scenes, recognizing the various trades who worked on the church.  There were also some modern sculptures.

This church really stands out as its interior is so different to others in Paris, it has huge steel arches, that reflect man‚Äôs labour in industry and act as a symbolic symbiosis between god and man. The light coming on through the stained glass is magical and the organ is a sight to behold.  The place is a little bit off the main tourist trail, but it‚Äôs absolutely worth your time and you have the Montparnasse tower nearby as well as the large cemetery.

LOVED this church. It was apparently built at the same time as the Eiffel Tower and the steel used in the interior reflects Paris' fascination with that kind of steel construction. Very dramatic but peaceful. Depending on where you are coming from it is quite a schlep but I found it worthwhile. I also checked out the Montparnasse cemetery while I was here (which is beautiful and where Jean Paul Sartre and Simon De Beauvoir are buried).

Interesting history: When construction for the Eiffel tower began in 1887, workers from nearby towns migrated to Paris, mostly settling in Montparnasse. A thoughtful move to provide these workers a place of worship, Paroisse Notre-Dame-du- Travail, was built from recycled material from the Palace of Industry built for the 1855 World's Fair. Quite difficult to find because it is tucked behind the place de Catalogne. And, if one is looking for a "quirky" structure (as blogs would describe it),  it could be missed because it has quite an ordinary exterior. However,  inside is  an extraordinarily unadorned interior composed of a nave and four aisles. The exposed,  exceptionally light iron frame not only create an industrial aesthetic but becomes a fitting tribute to the workers' dedication to their craft.
Peaceful Church industrialstyle iron pillars and good architecture. late 1800s modern church. ‚ù§Ô∏è
The Church built in 1900 by Astruc, is impressive for its distinctly "factory" style.
Very interesting gem in the city, gorgeous architecture.

A really interesting church, the steel beam construction makes it feel more like a factory than a church but it fits really wel!  Definitely a must see, especially if architecture is something you're interested in!
Hidden gem.  Beautiful and unique inside. Worth a visit
Factory style church, really something different to visit if you are around
Very beautiful modernistic church with its metal beam vaulted ceiling and beautiful frescoes surrounding the nave
Very interesting architecture, something different from other churches in Paris.
Very serene church, beautifully unique architecture inside.
Very eclectic, nice and quiet to visit
Unique industrial age Cathedral
Very special church with iron construction. From the time of the tour Eiffel construction.
Very interesting architectural style.
Amazing detail with a peacefull ambience.
A spectacular church!
Metalic construction, impressed

A church full of serenity with an incredible industrial-style interior‚Ä¶. Absolutely worth visiting. You can also enjoy a very pretty rotunda park, surrounded by glass buildings, a few steps from the church.

A surprising church! The architecture of this church makes it an unusual monument. In fact the vaults are made of metal which gives a very industrial side that we are not used to seeing in a church. It is an original place of worship. Quiet and very well maintained place. Beautiful paintings.

Church both beautiful and original, built around 1900 with metal arches from a pavilion from the Universal Exhibition of 1855. The vault is reminiscent of that of the Orsay station, all things considered. It is very bright.  There are beautiful catechetical frescoes on the aisles and has a sort of mezzanine.  She is silent and prayerful  I recommend it
A unique Church built with a metal structure made by workers who worked on works for the 1889 universal exhibition.
Beautiful unusual church, beautiful architecture, different from other churches

This church is a remarkable place; I highly recommend the visit. Upon entering, one is immediately surprised by the apparent lightness of the iron beams, which are enough to intrigue Parisians with their similarity to those of the Eiffel Tower. The atmosphere there is very airy and very pleasant, and as long as we take care to find out about the origin of this atypical construction, and this original layout, we immediately learn that it was the workers of the iron lady who also built this building!

Visited in April 2023. The Notre-Dame du Travail Church is a religious building to visit if you are passing through the 14th arrondissement of Paris.  The exterior of the church appears quite classic. However, the interior is truly surprising with metallic elements: arches, the nave, the organ, some of which point horizontally.  In the end, an atypical church. The theme of work is approached according to religion, it is quite unique.

Very beautiful place of worship. Magnificent architecture from the outside as well as the inside, once inside you very quickly forget that you are in Paris and you feel like you are in a splendid place.  Special motion for the staff who are very kind and friendly, I have never had such an in-depth philosophical discussion as at the Notre Dame du Champ church.  Ps: ramp with disabled access from the side.

Surprising !!! A must see ! Its metal structure reminds us of old railway stations... This cast iron ensemble is softened by all the white chapels and choir where small flowers have been painted in pastel colors. Note the sublime monumental statues. Definitely worth the detour! With children, it's a treat because it's different from anything they've seen so far ‚ô•Ô∏è

Located not far from Montparnasse station and in front of a pleasant park, this church will delight you. Its facade is majestic and in the bell tower you can see a superb bell which has a historical past (coming from Crimea). Its interior is disturbing with its metal structures and its "Eiffel-like" beams which give it an industrial style, high ceilings and large surface area. Beautiful religious furniture, superb altar and beautiful chapels too, surely one of the most surprising churches in Paris.

While many churches have delicate carvings, you may be surprised by the exposed steel structure. However, even though it has many curves and is made of steel, it is beautiful without being clunky. It was created in the early 20th century, during the Paris World's Fair.
